name: Clin T
title: Clinical T
notes:
**Note 1:**  The assignment of the T1 category for cutaneous squamous cell carcinomas with one or no high-risk features is based on tumor size.  A physician's statement of the T1 category may be used to code both tumor size and/or primary tumor if this is the only information in the medical record regarding one or both of these fields. The two fields are coded separately though.

**Note 2:**  TNM 7th Edition T1 and T2 categories are based on size and high risk features and not depth of invasion or extension. AJCC 7th Edition includes a T3 category for head and neck skin primaries only.

*Note 3:** For the following descriptions, assign the appropriate T category (T1 or T2) based on the tumor size.

    Adjacent connective tissue excluding skeletal muscle
    Confined to scrotum
    Skeletal muscle
    Subcutaneous tissue
    Underlying cartilage

    Adjacent organs/structures:
        Male genital organs:
            Epididymis
            Penis
            Prostate
            Spermatic cord
            Testis
    Further contiguous extension:
    Other organs and structures in male pelvis:
        Bladder
        Rectum
        Urethra

    Localized, NOS

**Note 3:**  In the case of multiple simultaneous tumors, code the tumor with the greatest extension.

**Note 4:**  Skin ulceration does not alter the T category.
rows: Tumor more than 2 cm in greatest dimension

Tumor with direct or perineural invasion of skull
base or axial skeleton

Bone:
    Axial or appendicular skeleton

Stated as T4

Unknown; extension not stated
Not documented in patient record
Tumor 2 cm or less in greatest dimension
